Asoka (Saraca Indica) : 

 Saraca Indica is a plant belonging to the Caesalpinioideae subfamily of the legume family. 



Uses : 

 Bark of tree is used as astringent.
 Used for controlling Diabetes.

Neem (Azadirachta Indica) : 

 Azadirachta indica, also known as Neem, Neem tree, and Indian Lilac is a tree in the mahogany family Meliaceae.


 Uses : 

 Used for bloody nose, skin ulcers, leprosy.
 Used for gum diseases, liver problems.
 Used to treat chicken pox.

Tulsi (Basil Leaves) : 

 Is an aromatic plant in the family which is native to the Indian subcontinent and widespread as a cultivated plant throughout the Southeast Asian tropics.


Uses : 

 Tulsi is taken as herbal tea. 
 It is used against the insects and bacteria.
 Helps in curing malaria.

Coconut tree (Cocos nucifera) : 

 The term coconut can refer to the entire coconut palm or the seed, or the fruit, which, botanically, is a drupe, not a nut. 


 Uses : 

 Antifungal and antimicrobial treatment for skin and mouth problems such as ring worms, candidiasis, psoriasis, sores, skin burns, sunburns, toothache, sore throat and ulcers. 
 Coconut oil is used to treat scalp and hair problems. From greying hair, dandruff to baldness.
